Meet Huawei Campus Ambassadors from 15 different Kenyan Universities.These students work as an interface between Huawei and the larger student body at their Campus.Through this program, the students have a first hand opportunity to participate in workshops locally and abroad, join technical training workshops and seminars organized by Huawei, receive free Exam vouchers on Huawei Certification courses.Most importantly, the students have the opportunity to interact with Huawei HR and technical experts to gain in-depth knowledge on how to work in a fast paced ICT firm such as Huawei.

During our Q3 Meetup on 6th September a discussion was held on the 2019-2020 Huawei ICT Competition and its benefits to students working towards a Career in ICT.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Huawei  today awarded the 20 top students from the National Final of the Huawei ICT Competition 2019-2020. The winning students were drawn from JKUAT, Laikipia University, University of Nairobi, Kabarak University, Strathmore University and Multimedia University.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Huawei today announced the winners of the 2019 -2020 Huawei ICT competitions.The winning teams were drawn from Discover JKUAT  , Laikipia University-KE, University of Nairobi , Kabarak University, Strathmore University, and Multimedia University of Kenya .\nThe ICT Competition was announced in June 2019 and saw over 6,400 students from 40 universities across Kenya register to take part. The competition gave students the option to compete in either a Network or Cloud Track based on their career interests with Network Track featuring Security, Networking and WLAN while Cloud Track featured newer technologies such as Cloud Service, Big Data and AI.\nThe top 3 students from each Track will have the opportunity to proceed to the Regional Final in South Africa in February 2020 to represent Kenya and compete with teams from 8 other African countries. At the Awarding Ceremony, Huawei and other partner companies offered internships to 24 excellent students.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Huawei announces the much-awaited #HarmonyOS, the operating system that will provide users with a holistic intelligent experience across all devices and scenarios. https://tinyurl.com/y3ejv3b8 #HuaweiNow #HDC2019

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: At the Huawei Developer Conference today, Huawei launched HarmonyOS – a new microkernel-based, distributed operating system designed to deliver a cohesive user experience across all devices and scenarios. HarmonyOS is a lightweight, compact operating system with powerful functionality, and it will first be used for smart devices like smart watches, smart screens, in-vehicle systems, and smart speakers. Through this implementation Huawei aims to establish an integrated and shared ecosystem across devices, create a secure and reliable runtime environment, and deliver a holistic intelligent experience across every interaction with every device.

The Huawei Telemedicine Solution enables care-at-a-distance and extends the reach of quality healthcare to isolated locations with remote expert consultation, medical education & monitoring. It connects doctors & patients in different rooms over the web through HD audio & video. In 2016 Huawei started working with a social enterprise Microclinic Technologies to deploy the ZiDi software in King Farhad County Hospital in Lamu County .

It provides HD audiovisual recording and live broadcasting.More than 35,000 patients' data have been collected in the system bringing efficiencies and better quality healthcare .

text: Committed to providing easy voice communications for people across different geographies.
Communications for ALL - Huawei Sustainability

Huawei's RuralStar solution was launched in 2017 to reduce rural coverage costs. It is specifically designed to provide both 2G voice, SMS, and mobile money services as well as 3G broadband data services for rural communities. \nWith low power consumption, easy installation, and innovative technologies (including battery technology) and tower design, it shortens the payback period for carriers to less than five years and promotes rural network construction in emerging markets. \nHuawei deployed the first RuralStar Solution in Kenya for Safaricom in December 2017 and for the first time brought 2G and 3G network to Duse.Within two months there were 556 users with 95 using smartphones to access 3G broadband.

Topher White is the chief executive officer of Rainforest Connection (RFCx), a non-profit organization that upcycles old cellphones to help protect the rainforest from illegal logging. After seeing Topher’s great work through his inspirational Ted Talk, Huawei reached out to see if they could coll...
Saving the rainforest by listening

Topher White is the chief executive officer of Rain forest Connection (RFCx), a non-profit organization that up-cycles old cellphones to help protect the rain forest from illegal logging. After seeing Topher’s great work through his inspirational Ted Talk, Huawei reached out to see if they could collaborate and help this incredible cause. It turned out that RFCx were already using a large portion of up-cycled Huawei phones due to their impressive reliability at protecting the rain forest, and ability to work nonstop for up to 2 years. Huawei began conversations with RFCx and are now working with them to build a fully connected intelligent ecosystem across multiple rain forests.\nRead More :

text: Everyone must have access to good healthcare. We want to make this possible by reaching remote regions with technology. Here’s one example: http://tinyurl.com/yxu7aqy7 #WorldHealthDay #SDG3 #SDGs

Huawei believes that ICT is a force for good and is a key enabler of the SDGs. name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Huawei released its 2018 Annual Report today. According to the report, the company maintained strong business growth in 2018.
Huawei Releases its 2018 Annual Report: Bullish Growth in the Face of Adversity

Huawei released its 2018 Annual Report today. According to the report, the company maintained strong business growth in 2018. Its sales revenue rounded off at CNY721.2 billion, up 19.5% year-on-year; its net profit reached CNY59.3 billion, up 25.1% year-on-year.

In its carrier business, Huawei launched its latest 5G and SoftCOM AI solutions, focusing on making them as simple as possible to use and maintain. 2018 also saw ongoing innovation in domains like premium home broadband and the Internet of Things (IoT), helping carriers seize new growth opportunities. In 2018, the sales revenue of Huawei's carrier business reached CNY294 billion, roughly the same as the year prior.

In its enterprise business, Huawei continued providing cloud, big data, artificial intelligence (AI), and IoT solutions, as well as a range of products for data centers, all-flash storage, and WiFi. By integrating these technologies into its digital platform, Huawei has facilitated the construction of smart cities, safe cities, and smart campuses, and has helped drive the digital transformation of its customers in the finance, transportation, and energy sectors. In 2018, the sales revenue of Huawei's enterprise business reached CNY74.4 billion, up 23.8% year-on-year.

In its cloud business, Huawei launched 160 cloud services and 140 solutions, and worked with its partners to serve customers worldwide with 40 availability zones across 23 regions. Huawei has grown its list of partners to more than 6,000 in this domain, and is actively exploring the use of its AI services in more than 200 projects across 10 major industries.

In its consumer business, Huawei further increased its share of the global smartphone market and has further enhanced the positioning of its high-end devices. It has also made major breakthroughs in building an intelligent ecosystem for all user scenarios. In 2018, the sales revenue of Huawei's consumer business reached CNY348.9 billion, up 45.1% year-on-year.

Read more on -https://www.huawei.com/en/press-events/news/2019/3/huawei-2018-annual-report

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Samburu Girls’ Foundation was founded by Dr. Josephine Kulea, HSC, whose passion was drawn from being from a pastoralist community and observing practices such as FGM, beading (to mark them for sexual engagement from an early age) and child marriage where the girls are married off from as early as 11 years.  
The girls are given a safe place to stay and receive psychological support through counselling. The girls have overcome incredible challenges in their lives and have inspirational stories of hope. They also have a clear message for others in Kenyan society about the importance of eradicating these harmful practices and ensuring all girl receive a full education.
Through the  Huawei, Safaricom PLC , UNFPA Kenya  partnership ,the livelihoods of the girls at Samburu Girls Foundation has been transformed , the girls have become empowered through education and have a place where they feel  safe to call home that is safe far away from some cultural practices such as FGM. This has not only transformed lives of the girls but also of the communities around .
Huawei is keen on youth mentorship as a form of personal development as it provides a platform to learn from others, and to also meet people or figures who they can aspire to emulate. It also provides the youth with an up-close opportunity to ask and learn on a very inter-personal level.
Samburu Girls Foundation was started in 2011, and has over the years succeeded in to rescuing over 1,000 girls from Samburu, Isiolo, Laikipia and Marsabit counties.  Samburu Girls Foundation has not only rescued thousands of girls, but has also created an environment for them to receive education from the primary to the tertiary level

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Huawei is keen on youth mentorship as a form of personal development as it provides a platform to learn from others, and to also meet people or figures who they can aspire to emulate. It also provides the youth with an up-close opportunity to ask and learn on a very inter-personal level.
Huawei  collaboration with United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) and Safaricom hosted a mentorship session on for 15 young students from the Samburu Girls’ Foundation in Samburu County. 
During the mentoring session the girls learnt how dedication and overcoming challenges was and still is the very heart of Huawei's culture and success, as Huawei grew from a group of 6 people searching for business opportunities in rural China and then struggling in remote corners of Africa to build telecommunications networks to the successful global company that it is now. 
Even now Huawei is an employee owned company and thus able to share it's profits with staff whose dedication has contributed to the company's success. The message for the girls was that their incredible strength from overcoming their challenges will stand them in good stead to have success in the future.
#womenshistorymonth

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
In a bid to decongest Nairobi traffic, Huawei in partnership with Kenya Urban Roads Authority (KURA) implemented the Intelligent Transportation System (ITS) to use intelligent surveillance cameras, traffic flow cameras, variable timing traffic lights, and a control center to monitor and manage traffic. 
ITS is not only limited to controlling traffic congestion and information but also improves the overall road safety for both vehicles and pedestrians, and improves the infrastructure usage
So far the system has been implemented in 7 major junctions from Yaya Center along Kilimani and Kileleshwa Ring Roads to Riverside with the aim to expand to various other junctions’ across the city in the future.
Visit our website for more : https://www.huawei.com/ke/

text: Africa’s digital landscape growing

Connectivity is not just about coverage and speed, but also usage and inclusion. Investing more in digital skills is key for digital empowerment ensuring that people can use digital technologies for innovation in addition to consuming ideas.
For ICT to better play its role as growth accelerator and social equalizer, we need to connect more households and businesses, especially SMEs, and upgrade the digital infrastructure.
Read more on Huawei's role in bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.
Link: https://www.standardmedia.co.ke/commentary/article/2001394648/africas-digital-landscape-growing
Such policy moves should be encouraged, as they open the door for ICT companies to make greater contribution to social-economic development.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Huawei continues to support the The Ministry of Health  efforts in fighting and managing the response of COVID-19 in Kenya. Huawei has so far donated three teleconferencing systems to the ministry to enhance communications with experts from China and across the globe.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
The Chief Administrative Secretary for Health, Dr. Rashid Aman received Videoconferencing equipment from Huawei Kenya to foster real time face to
face communication and interactions without being constrained by physical distances.

“This is the 3rd donation to the ministry that has  improved communication, training and coordination during this COVID-19 pandemic,” said Dr. Aman.

The teleconferencing system which was delivered by Fiona Pan, Deputy CEO, Public Affairs, Huawei Kenya has been useful in facilitating video calls with experts in China to learn from their experience in managing the response to the COVID-19 outbreak. 

Kenya was the first country in Africa  to hold a videoconference with Chinese Ministry of Health, custom officials and others experts using the first donated equipment on 18th March 2020. 

The delegation in Kenya included the African Center for Disease Control and more than 20 other Kenyan and African officials and experts. The purpose was to share information on the fight against the COVID-19 pandemic and discuss the best approaches for prevention and control.
 
Ends...

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: blog.huawei.com
How Learning Is Staying ON for Kenya’s Zetech University during the Pandemic

Zetech University is a Huawei-authorized ICT Academy that has integrated Huawei-certified ICT Associate Routing & Switching (HCIA R&S) into its BSc in Information Technology curricula – this was one of many courses that was affected when face-to-face learning was suspended at the university.\n\nThrough collaboration with Huawei ICT Academy Kenya, the university was among the first to start an online HCIA-R&S class on the Huawei Welink platform. Students were provided with data bundles worth 2,000 Kenyan shillings (around US$20) each and were able to access resources from the Huawei ICT Academy platform.
Like in much of the world, education in Kenya has been disrupted by COVID-19, with schools and universities across the nation shutting their doors. But that doesn’t mean education has to stop…

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
#Didyouknow that approximately 4% of the Kenyan population are not covered by voice network, 20% not covered by broadband internet and around 40% without smart devices.

Huawei has worked with telcos in Kenya to build 2G, 3G, 4G and now 5G networks. We have deployed over 3500 mobile towers and continue to deploy more in areas without previous 
coverage ensuring connectivity to all as part of the government's Universal Access Initiative.
We continue to support the government's ambitious plan to improve the efficiency of its operations in the delivery of services using ICT through ensuring access to high speed broadband.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Huawei has supported the  Lewa Safari Marathon organized by the Lewa Wildlife Conservancy for the last 13 years, supporting its conservation efforts and the communities around the conservancy.

With the event going virtual for the second year, you too can play a role in conservation and community empowerment by signing up for the Virtual Lewa Safari Marathon taking place on Saturday 26th June.

Visit https://www.lewasafarimarathon.com/ to register !

Registration for the Virtual Lewa Safari Marathon STILL OPEN.

1. Visit lewasafarimarathon.com
2. Register FOR FREE. Every runner will receive an e-certificate.
3. Opt to receive a 🏅 (with a minimum of KShs.2500 to support conservation/community initiatives)
4. Run from wherever you choose
5. Track your run on a fitness app!
6. TAKE LOTS OF PICTURES! Share on social media pages. Tag us and/or use the hashtags #lewasafarimarathon #TuskLewaSafariChallenge﻿
7. Send screenshots of your run stats to marathon@lewa.org
8. Receive your certificate.
9. Not much of a runner? Not to worry. Register anyway. Make a donation of your choice to support conservation and community initiatives. We'll run the marathon on your behalf 🙂
10. Also, you rock!

Tusk 
Safaricom PLC 
Huawei Mobile 
Eliud Kipchoge 
Martin Buzora Film & Photography

We are pleased to announce Huawei ICT Competition 2022-2023 is now open for registration!

Huawei ICT Competition is a competitive ICT talent exchange event developed by Huawei for university/college students globally. To promote the healthy development of the ICT talent ecosystem and support the integration of industry and education, Huawei invites Huawei ICT Academies and Universities/Colleges with relevant majors to participate in the 7th annual Huawei ICT Skills Competition. Globally 150,000+ students, 2,000+ Colleges/Universities in 85 Countries and regions have joined Huawei ICT Competition.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Huawei's 6th Global ICT Competition drew to a close on June 25. The Global Final has covered 82 countries, 2,000 universities and over 150,000 students. Total 130 Team from across the world qualified for the Global Final in Network, Cloud & Innovation Competition

The Kenya Team won first prize in the Innovation Competition beating universities such as University of Reading, UK, City University of Hong Kong, China, South China Normal University, China etc. 

Three students from Kenyatta University were Ashtone Onyango, Stephen Katona and Catherine Wanja guided by their Lecturer Mr. Michael Munyao. The Kenya Team from KU used Huawei’s AI technology to design an innovative program for detecting early childhood pneumonia, which was highly recognized by judges and won the first prize in the Innovation Competition.

Kenya also scooped the third prize i with a team of students from Machakos University in the Network track and another team from Kenyatta University in Cloud Track.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Safaricom PLC CEO, Mr. Peter Ndegwa stressed that the East Africa’s first 5G network livestream at the Amboseli National Park, Kenya, was used to showcase the incredible beauty of the wildlife and Environment in Kenya. “We believe that 5G has a great future in enriching and enhancing the experience of tourism in this country and across the World. I am delighted that you are able to watch”, he said.\n\nThis was during the #WorldEnvironmentDay on 5th June. A partnership between #Huawei, Safaricom PLC, CGTN Africa and Kenya’s ministry of Tourism

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: “Kenya is not only a leading tourism destination, we are also a leading technology nation” - CS Ministry of Tourism Kenya, Najib Balala speaking on #WorldEnvironmentDay, with the theme calling for celebrating, protecting and restoring the planet, as he commended Huawei, Safaricom PLC and CGTN for using technology to do the first 5G livestream in EastAfrica to showcase kenya’s beauty at the Amboseli National Park, Kenya, in light of the economic recovery post COVID-19.\n\nIn efforts to lower the impact on the environment, the livestream was powered by Huawei’s FusionSolar Green Power Home Solution that ensured the livestream was as environment friendly as possible.

text: Live From the Land of Giants - A World Environmental Day Special

The 2022 World Environment Day aims for sustainable living in harmony with nature. Kenya prides itself for its beautiful wildlife and National Parks that attract many from around the world. 

Therefore, today on World Environment Day, we bring you a live tour from Amboseli National Park with CGTN Africa to inform and educate, and also to attract you to visit physically, as tourism supports local jobs and enables conservation activities.

The live stream is using the high speeds of a 5G network from Safaricom and Huawei and to lower the activity's environmental impact in line with World Environment Day, the broadcast equipment is powered by clean solar energy using Huawei's Fusion Solar Green Power Home Solution.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Government committed to have more women in ICT related jobs

The government has rolled out an initiative focused on encouraging young girls to take up courses in ICT, science and mathematics in efforts to boost gender balance in the fields and offer job opportunities for women.

 Maureen Mbaka, CAS Ministry of ICT, Innovation and Youth Affairs said that she started the initiative dubbed ‘girls in ICT initiative’ which encourages young women and girls to actively participate in careers in ICT, Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM).

The CAS said that they are working together with KONZA Technopolis, Huawei women in Tech, and other partners where they have held mentorship forums, cloud computing trainings aimed at encouraging women to take up careers in the male dominated field of technology.

Speaking on Friday at the Centre for Mathematics, Science and Technology Education in Africa (CEMASTEA) during the closing ceremony of the Young Scientists Kenya (YSK) boot camp, Mbaka said that only 30 percent of the careers in Tech are occupied by women and there is need to have more women in the field as she expressed optimism seeing that more young girls than boys participated in this year’s YSK boot camp.

“Next week is the girls in ICT week where every 28th of April we celebrate the women in the tech space. I would like to urge each one of us to use this time to go into our communities and encourage our young girls to take up course in ICT,” said Mbaka.  

The CAS highlighted that their mandate as a ministry is to facilitate universal access to ICT infrastructure and service to empower Kenyans in their quest for economic growth.

“On tech skills, the government is committed to promoting the fundamental role that tech skills play in tackling real world problems and in furthering key 21st century skills required in the job market,” said Mbaka.

She said that the ministry has designed and prepared programs to prepare the Kenyan youth for the digital world which include the digital literacy program which is aimed at impact digital skills to young minds at an early age.

“The program has seen the distribution of over one million devices in over 22, 000 schools as well as training of 300,000 teachers on digital skills,” said Mbaka.

The CAS said that the government also has the SchoolNet program which they are piloting and it involves connecting schools to internet services and so far 13 schools have been connected with a total of 1,500 schools earmarked for connectivity.

CEMASTEA deputy director Lydia Muriithi said that next year the country will have the first class of junior secondary under the new Competence Based Curriculum (CBC) and they are working hard to see how sciences will be related at that level.

Muriithi said that at the junior secondary they have the duty to make the students understand the importance of sciences so that they can specialize in the STEM areas when they join senior secondary and this will guide them in their career choices.

YSK chair of the programs committee Ben Roberts said that the YSK in Kenya is modelled around the Ireland Youth in Science which transformed the country from a potatoes producing country into a tech hub housing headquarters for some of the giant tech companies in the world.

He said that in Kenya they are adopting the leave no one behind model where they focus on the rural and remote areas where the infrastructure is not so good and the students there find it hard to access STEM courses and the required teaching skills and laboratories.

Ends…

Young Science Certificate Awarding Ceremony.
Youth
Nairobi, Friday April 22, 2022 Kenya News Agency - KNA  by Joseph Ng’ang’a

 Photos by Widen Ratemo  Ministry of Information, Communications and Technology , Public Communication Unit.
Cemastea 
#stemchallenge

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Huawei signed a Letter of IntenMinistry of Information, Communications and Technology on ICT Talent Development during a ceremony officiated by the Ministry’s Cabinet Secretary Hon. Joe Mucheru, Principal Secretary Mr. Jerome Ochieng and Huawei Kenya’s CEO, Mr. Will Meng.  
The collaboration agreement will see the two organizations partner over the next three years to train 200 high-level advanced ICT experts and 5,000 ICT technical experienced professionals. They also aim to further train 2,500 civil servants and 12,000 graduates, students and youth countrywide. 

At the time of the announcement, 900 civil servants from across various government agencies also graduated from a pilot of the capacity building program.  12 of them were awarded for their outstanding performance.  The training was categorized into two cohorts covering technical and non-technical training.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Huawei has announced the winners of the 2021-2022 Huawei ICT Competition national finals. The prizes were presented to six National Finalists in addition to six teams comprising of eighteen students that will be proceeding to the regional finalists. They took home various prizes including laptops, mobile phones and vouchers for Huawei certified training. The winners were part of the 150 students shortlisted from a pool of over 3000 applicants who submitted their applications for the competition.

The National finalists received 1st, 2nd and 3rd place awards under the Network and Cloud track representing students from Discover JKUAT  United States International University - Africa Zetech University, Moi University Eldoret Kenya  - Foundation of Knowledge and the University of Nairobi. The teams proceeding to the Regional Finals comprise of three teams competing under the Network Track from The University of Nairobi, JKUAT and Machakos University, two teams representing the Cloud track from Kenyatta University and Laikipia University and one team under the Innovation Track from Kenyatta University.

Laikipia University, The Technical University of Kenya and University of Nairobi also received the Excellent Academy Award. The award was as a result of their outstanding performance in Huawei Certification training whereby over 400 students received training.

Read More - https://www.huawei.com/ke/news/ke/2022/huawei-unesco-root-for-industry-led-training

Huawei ICT Academy Kenya

#connection #Glory #Future 
#HuaweiICTCompetition

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Huawei Kenya partnered with the Kenya Editors Guild to organize a half-day seminar on Technology trends. The seminar brought together a variety of experts from the ICT industry and the media industry to discuss the latest developments in areas including technology infrastructure, digital skills, digital power, cloud and Artificial Intelligence (AI). 

The discussion covered a wide range of topics including understanding what AI is and how it can help, for example in predicting weather forecasts and helping farmers; how grid-tied solar power can help manufacturers save money with a quick return on investment; how strong data protection legislation combined with access to large amounts of local open data could unlock business and job opportunities in Kenya; and the risks and opportunities that AI offers the media industry.

It was clear that AI will be the hottest trend for 2024 with the media seeking to better understand it in order to report on its risks, benefits, opportunities and role in the country’s development.

text:
A resounding applause to the brilliant minds who conquered the Communications Authority of Kenya Cybersecurity Bootcamp and Hackathon with unmatched skill and determination! 

Your expertise in safeguarding digital realms is awe-inspiring! From identifying vulnerabilities to crafting ingenious solutions, you've shown the world what true cybersecurity champions are made of.

But the journey doesn't end here! The next part of the competition awaits, and we have no doubt that you'll excel and shine even brighter as you compete with the other regions in the nation-wide finals.  Keep raising the bar and taking on new challenges!

We had the pleasure of being joined by Chief officer Smart Nairobi – Tiras Wainaina Njoroge, who was representing Governor Nairobi County. In his remarks, he acknowledged the efforts of the students and advised them to use their skills in a useful and ethical way.

We are thrilled to honor the brilliant minds who fearlessly delved into the world of cybersecurity at our extraordinary Awarding Ceremony!

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
We are thrilled to announce the upgrade of our mobile digital classroom, DigiTruck, to the lightning-fast 5G network! We would like to thank all our partners for their incredible support in bringing this transformation to life. 

With the power of 5G, DigiTruck will revolutionize digital education, providing faster internet access, immersive learning experiences, and bridging the digital divide in our community. We would like to appreciate Safaricom PLC for their unwavering commitment to empowering communities through technology.

Together, we are creating a future where every learner has equal access to quality education and the digital tools they need to succeed. Digital skills are vital in today's world, empowering individuals to thrive in the digital age and participate fully in the global economy.

In attendance were Ronald Fulani, DCC in Mombasa County, Nahmoud Noor, Chief Mentor Swahilipot Hub, Dianah Ogeto, Women in Tech Lead at Safaricom, John Njathi, Coast Director at Safaricom PLC, Ken Ambani, CECM of the Department of Public Service Administration, Youth, Gender, Sports, and Social Services and John Musuva, General Administration and Coordination of the Education County Department.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
#ICYMI Last week at the Dx5ve Africa Fintech Summit, we had Mark Wang, Director, Solution Architect, Huawei Cloud, Southern Africa delivering his keynote speech on Strategies for Successful Digital Transformation. While talking about the Fintech space, Mark mentioned "People are changing, the Gen-Z is beginning to have spending power, and it will gradually increase. Habits are also changing. Today, everyone prefers simplicity and novelty. In order to achieve successful Digital Transformation, organizations must understand the kind of business to develop, the business KPIs, what technology to use, and the power of big data”

Talks around digital transformation, digital, and digitization have ruled around different sectors ever since the pandemic. While, we won’t go further into the differences or similarities between the three terms, most people believe that digital transformation encompasses them all. 

We also had Catherine Maina, Senior Cloud Solution Manager at Huawei Kenya breaking down digital transformation to four important things that a bank needs to look at. These are; Innovation, Infrastructure, Scalability, and Security. “In the platforms that you are building and the applications that you have, it is important that you think of how you are going to scale out with them. To scale out, you need technology solutions that will help you achieve in target,” She said.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Huawei Kenya's Adam Lane is speaking at the KICTANet Kenya Internet Governance Forum 2023 about cybersecurity challenges and Huawei's initiatives to build trust, skills and secure products.

He introduced Huawei's commitment to meeting international standards such as the Network Equipment Security Assurance Scheme (NESAS). Independent labs can verify if equipment meets standards, providing factual evidence of security which enables trust.

He also introduced some skills building efforts from cyber hyiene for rural youth delivered from the DigiTruck to advanced network security skills delivered with universities and through bootcamps with the CA.

Finally he explained that privacy and security are core to all Huawei's products and services, from R&D on with very demanding requirements to be met advanced functions in corporate and consumer products.

#KeIGF2023

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
CONGRATULATIONS to the incredible 189 students who have successfully completed our 6-week digital skills training in the DigiTruck in Vihiga County! 

In a ceremony that was graced by Ababu Namwamba, Cabinet Secretary Ministry of Youth Affairs, The Arts and Sports , Vihiga County Governor Wilber Khasilwa Ottichilo 
and the DigiTruck partners, we saw the graduates receive certificates for their hard work and determination during the whole course of training. We also had the DigiTruck Innovation Competition Winners receive trophies, Huawei tablets and airtime from 
Safaricom PLC 

In his speech, the CS Ababu Namwamba lauded the county's efforts in ensuring the students enroll in the digital skills training, emphasizing that digital skills are the future, and that digital illiteracy will lock the youth out of existence. He stated that his ministry values the DigiTruck program greatly and that the government is happy to continue rolling out this program together with Huawei and its partners.

The Vihiga county governor Ottichilo, on the other hand, congratulated the 189 youth who completed the training in the 6 weeks and encouraged them to keep up with the digital skills in the fast-changing world. He encouraged them to keep learning and assured them of the county's support in achieving their dreams and goals.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
His Excellency Governor Wilber Wilber Khasilwa Ottichilo today afternoon launched the Huawei Kenya Digital Literacy Program at the County Headquarters in the company of their CSR manager Ian Korir. 

The Truck, equipped with computer accessories will go round the Vocational Training Centers (VTCs) across the County offering the youth digital literacy programs for one month. The trainees will then be issued with certificates that are of market standard hence boosting their CVs. 

Ottichilo assured the youth that this will go a long way in helping them attain self sustainability through engaging in online jobs. The County Government of Vihiga has also partnered with the Ministry of ICT to set up ICT training centres at Kaimosi, Sabatia and Bunyore Technical Centres. 

The county boss also said that the partnership will see internet hotspots installed in all major markets in Vihiga county starting with Mbale where cabling has already been done. 

Huawei, through the digischool program will also equip schools with internet connectivity. The program will start at Ebbiba Primary next month and spread to other schools within the county.
County Government of Vihiga · 在 Office of the Governor Vihiga County

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
CABINET SECRETARY HON. ABABU NAMWAMBA PRESIDE OVER HUAWEI DIGITRUCK FLAG-OFF

The Cabinet Secretary for Ministry of Youth Affairs, Sports & the Arts Hon Ababu-Terrah Egh this afternoon presided over the flagging off of the Huawei  DigiTruck in Budalangi, Busia County. This marks the beginning of a six weeks digital training that will culminate in certification of 150 youth from Busia County.

The CS, who was joined by Huawei Kenya Deputy CEO Government Affairs Mr. Adam Lane, lauded Huawei for the Tech4All initiative, which he said had done much in eradicating digital illiteracy in Kenya.

"I wish to commend Huawei for agreeing to partner with us, the ministry, to train our youth in these key digital skills, which sits well with the government\

The Huawei DigiTruck was officially flagged off by CS \nHon. Ababu Namwamba over the weekend to begin training the youth in Busia county on digital skills. We plan to work with the Ministry of youth affairs, Sports & the Arts and county government to train over 100 youth in the area during the stay.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Today at the opening of the Kenya Innovation Week: Commonwealth Edition, we were pleased to have His Excellency, President of The Republic of Kenya William Samoei Ruto  and The Rt. Hon Patricia Scotland KC, Secretary-General of The Commonwealth visit the Huawei DigiTruck, and they spoke with 6 grassroots innovators in the DigiTruck.

During his opening remarks at the Kenya Innovation Week, President Ruto specifically called out the DigiTruck as a programme promoting grassroots innovation: “I also appreciate the work that Huawei Technologies continue to do in building digital skills and promoting innovations through the country from the grassroots. The DigiTruck programme is a truly bottom-up intervention to promote the development of sound innovative capacity through the provision of technology, the internet and mentorship.”

The innovators in the DigiTruck, who came from different counties across Kenya, Vihiga, Busia and Mombasa counties, were excited to share their innovative ideas which they came up with as part of the DigiTruck Innovation Competition. This competition selects the best 3 business ideas that the trained youth come up with on how to use their digital skills to improve their community.
 Kenya National Innovation Agency

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
On this #Worldchildrensdayke, Huawei is thrilled to join the global community in honoring the incredible potential and boundless dreams of every child. 

We were honored today to be with children from Kusitawi Villages Children's home in Thika together with Hon. Florence Bore, CS Ministry of Labour and Social Protection, PS Joseph Motari and Thika Town MP Hon. Alice Ng'ang'a to celebrate these children.

Children are the architects of tomorrow, and it's our duty to ensure their safety and nurture a brighter future.
On this special day, let's raise awareness and work together to enhance opportunities for children on the internet while ensuring positive experiences. Huawei is devoted to building a better future for all children, aligning with the Global Strategy on the Rights of the Child and the Sustainable Development Goals. Happy World Children's Day!

text: Huawei delighted to be a part of this collaboration to work with the First Lady Mama Rachel Ruto and MaMa Doing Good to drive digital literacy among women across Kenya and to ensure that no woman is left behind in this digital age.

In a recent engagement, First Lady Mama Rachel Ruto met with Huawei Global Director Corporate Communications, Joanna Ma, to discuss areas of collaboration and partnership to improve and promote digital literacy in support of women empowerment. 

Mama Doing Good has already signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Huawei to promote digital transformation. The collaboration aims to empower women in Kenya with essential digital skills and bridge the digital divide. 

The partnership reflects both organisations' shared commitment to creating an equitable society where everyone lives a happy, fulfilled and transformed life, and is in line with Kenya's Vision 2030.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
“In today’s world, no discipline stands alone independent of technology. If you think education, you have to think EduTech, for Agriculture, AgriTech, finance, FinTech, if you think Health, you have to think HealthTech and so on.

Meaning that, Digital Skills, today, are as important as Basic Literacy and Numeracy.

That is why we are so grateful for this Dagoretti South Partnership with Huawei and Computer for Schools where we are equipping 189 deserving School Leavers with the Basic Digital Literacy Skills in the Huawei DigiTruck programme. 

It’s an innovative class on wheels!”

John Kj Kiarie, M. P.,
Dagoretti South.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: On Saturday 6th December, Huawei Technologies, in partnership with local stakeholders proudly celebrated the graduation of 180 young individuals who have successfully completed the Huawei DigiTruck program in Dagoretti South. The ceremony, held marks a significant milestone in empowering the next generation of tech leaders with the digital skills required to thrive in today’s fast-evolving ICT industry.\nThe Huawei DigiTruck initiative, aims to bridge the digital divide by providing accessible ICT training in underserved communities. Through the program, participants gained vital skills in areas such as cloud computing, coding, and digital literacy, equipping them for the future of work in the technology sector, in line with the government’s agenda of building a digital workforce and economy.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Catch our exciting POV of what was happening as we toured China as part of the #SeedsForTheFuture program Digital Tour and #LEAP Summit. From cutting-edge technology to cultural discoveries, the journey was an awe-inspiring one. Watch our best moments below.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Last week, we had 4 Kenyans join the #SeedsForTheFuture tour in China for a period of 1 week. This tour saw them visit various industries including the Huawei exhibition centres, the   R&D centre in Shenzhen, a tour of the digital government offices, attending the MWC in Shanghai, visiting the Huawei flagship store and capping the tour by attending the Huawei LEAP summit. The tour was quite enlightening to the 4 youth, who had an amazing experience and had lots to share about the experience.\n\nAs part of the tour, the 4 attended the GSMA #MWC24 in Shanghai where they were able to interact with several emerging technologies, which was a great eye opener for them. They visited the various exhibitions to see the progresses being made in the tech industries, such as Artificial Intelligence, 5G and so much more.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: The Principal Secretary State Department for The blue Economy & Fisheries, Ministry of Mining, Blue Economy and Maritime Affairs Ms. Betsy Njagi attended the Global #Tech4Nature Summit 2024 Co-hosted by IUCN in Shenzhen, China, the summit marks the commencement of Phase 2 of the Tech4Nature global partnership and further promote innovation in nature conservation.\n\nAligned with Huawei’s #TECH4ALL initiative and IUCN’s Green List, Tech4Nature represents the joint vision of both partners to develop technological solutions for Protected and Conserved Areas (PCA) across the globe. It is also the first time that either Huawei or IUCN has established a major partnership spanning both the Information and Communication Technology (ICT) and nature conservation sectors.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: During the 2nd day of the African Development Bank Group meetings, John Kiarie, Chairman of the ICT Committee in the National Assembly, gave the keynote speech at the Africa AI Innovation Summit, lauding the key players in the AI space and encouraging the African countries to step up in the space. \n\n“At each instance in history, when Africa comes to the crossroads, the question is asked, should Africa look to borrow from the East or look to learn and benefit from the West, and I am offering, that at this instance, with the fourth Industrial Revolution, it is not a time for Africa to look East or West, it is a time for Africa to look within." The Huawei #ICTCompetition Global Final came to an end in Shenzhen China. This year more than 170,000 students joined from 80 countries and 2,800 Universities.
160 teams qualified for the Global Final round that was held in Shenzhen China from the 23rd to 26th May 2024.
The team that represented Kenya in the finals in the different categories bagged the following prizes

1. First Prize
Two Kenyans Teams: Network Team 1 & 2 

2. Second Prize
Kenya Computing Team 1  

3. Third Prize
Kenya Cloud Team 1 & 2 and Computing Team 2 

Other awards 
First prize in Cloud are Egypt, Singapore, Nigeria, Qatar, China 

First Award in Computing: Algeria, Tunisia, China, Eqypt, Kazkhatan, Tunisia

The Principal Secretary from Ministry of Education, Dr. Esther Thaara Muoria joined the Global Final Ceremony where the Kenyan students were awarded for their outstanding performance.

At the same ceremony Kenya School of TVET was awarded as a new Huawei Instructor Support Center in Kenya, the school will function as a center for ICT Cutting edge technologies training for TVET teachers in Kenya.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Today we flagged off 18 students and 6 instructors who are going to China to represent Kenya in the Global finals of the #ICTCompetition. The flag off was graced by The Speaker of the National Assembly Hon. Dr. Moses Wetang'ula, The chair of the ICT Committee in the National Assembly and the Huawei Kenya CEO. These students successfully qualified for the global finals by participating in the Networking, Cloud and Computing tracks, each having 2 teams of 3 students each.

In attendance was also the Senator of Bungoma County Hon. David Wafula Wakoli, The Vice Chancellor of Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology, Prof. Victoria Ngumi and Mr. Paul Mungai Director of Education at the Ministry of Education. 

We would like to wish the students the very best as they fly the Kenyan flag high in Shenzhen, China as they compete against more than 400 students from other countries across the globe. We are proud of you!

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Today, 350 youth from Uasin Gishu county graduated from the DigiTruck training program. The program, which took 7 weeks in the county, saw the youth get trained on the much-needed digital skills that will even enable them to get jobs online and even market their goods online.

The event was officiated by the Uasin Gishu county women rep Gladys Boss Shollei, who emphasized the importance of digital skills in this day and age, and encouraged the youth to take up opportunities that are presented to them to keep up with the fast-changing world. 

As part of the training program, we had the DigiTruck Innovation Competition where some of the students in the truck participated to come up with innovative ideas through the digital skills acquired to solve problems that they face in their communities. In first place was Evance Muraya, second place was Margaret Nyambura and finally in third was Winnie Jemutai, whose ideas were outstanding and deserved recognition.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Today, Women in Technology Huawei Kenya (WITH) will partner to host an exclusive career fair at Jomo Kenyatta University - JKUAT, themed Empowering Women Leaders through New Career Paths, Growth Opportunities, and Tech Innovation for Social Impact, specially designed for young women pursuing STEM at the university level. \n\nJoin us to unlock opportunities for mentorship, career guidance, and networking, plus skill-building sessions designed to inspire and uplift. Attendees will also gain insights into Huawei’s impactful role in the industry, focusing on empowering women through tech.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Join the Huawei #AppCube Hackathon from Dec. 2-6 at Huawei’s Nairobi office!

Young innovators and software developers across Kenya are invited to create groundbreaking digital solutions for e-commerce, virtual learning, and connectivity. This event, hosted by Huawei, is all about empowering Kenya's digital economy with innovative tools.

Lin Xiaonan, Huawei Kenya’s Director of Delivery and Service, during Huawei’s Empowering Digital Transformation Forum in Nairobi, underscoring the company’s efforts to support Kenya’s transition into a digitally empowered economy, shares: “We believe in technology’s power to enhance lives and stimulate economic growth.”

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Join us for the 1st AppCube Hackathon Summit from 2nd to 6th December 2024 at Huawei Offices in Kenya. #AppCube, our low-code platform, makes it easy to create professional applications using drag-and-drop interfaces and visual tools, even without extensive coding knowledge.  \n\nScan the QR code on the banner to register. Exciting prizes await!

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Speaking at the Vice Chancellors roundtable discussion on the catalytic role of academic institutions in advancing innovation through science parks, Michael Kamau – Head of Huawei ICT Academy highlighted the critical role of private sector as an enabler in supporting a closed loop education system by providing insights in technology trends, influencing innovation by highlighting industry challenges and supporting ICT talent development initiatives. 

Cooperation’s such as the Luban workshop already established in several universities in Kenya including Machakos University, Taita Taveta and Meru University were highlighted as important projects in realizing specialized training to catalyze innovation in Kenya. 
 
Others in the panel were CEO KENIA Dr. Tonny Omwansa and Vice Chancellors from Zetech and Machakos University

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
During the conversation on partnerships for development through science parks and areas of innovation, Adam Lane shared how Huawei collaborates with Konza Technopolis. This has included supporting Machakos University to set up an IoT lab and Bachelors Course in IoT and Cloud Computing to provide talent to work in Konza. It also includes providing ICT infrastructure and training for Jitume Labs along with supporting research and advocacy for Jitume Labs.

Adam also introduced Huawei’s support for innovation in Academia including various innovation competitions and hackathon programs leveraging Huawei Cloud.

Other participants in the session included the DG of NACOSTI, CEO of Bridge Tech Global, Policy Manager of EPRA and the Economic Advisor for the Economic Innovation Partnership Program between South Korea and Kenya.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
The Huawei #ICTCompetition 2024-2025 is officially OPEN for registration! This is your chance to test your skills and push your boundaries in one of the biggest global competitions. 

Whether you're passionate about Cloud, Network, Computing, or have a groundbreaking idea in AI Innovation, we’ve got a track for you! Sharpen your knowledge, collaborate with like-minded peers, and compete at the highest level to showcase your expertise.

The National Finals will take place between November - December 2024. Those who qualify will get the opportunity to represent Kenya on an international stage through the Regional and Global Finals, among the brightest talents worldwide and stand a chance to win amazing rewards.

Don't miss this incredible opportunity to boost your career prospects! Register now and be part of the next wave of ICT innovators.

Register now: https://bit.ly/SAR2024-2025

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
We're excited to be part of the Expo On Specialized Learning Materials, Assistive Devices and Technology at kenya institute of special education showcasing the latest in technology and innovation. 

Visit our booth to learn more about how we’re driving digital inclusion and AI for special needs, making a real impact on persons living with disabilities.

Catch it live here: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=omgZOm7cj48&pp=ygUgS2VueWEgSW5zdGl0dXRlIG9mIHNwZWNpYWwgbmVlZHM%3D

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: #AI is unlocking new possibilities for digital inclusivity, empowering persons living with disabilities to lead more independent lives. From accessible tech to smarter assistive tools, AI is helping bridge the gap and create a more inclusive digital world.  \n\nBy supporting groundbreaking ideas, we aim to push the boundaries of what's possible and drive impactful solutions that make a real difference. Together, we can shape a future where technology serves everyone.  #AIForSpecialNeeds

name: Huawei  Kenya
text:
Today we were excited to bring back the #UnitechTalk after a long break! 

The talk was on The Thrilling Potential of #Cloud and #ArtificialIntelligence where we had experts from the field lead the conversation during the panel discussion which was moderated by Huawei's Winnie Chepkong'a. 

The panelists included Linet Kwamboka, Senior Manager Global Partnership for Sustainable Development Data , Dennis Mwagiru - Software Engineer, Royal Media Services, Elly Savatia - Founder & CEO @signvrse and James Sindani - Huawei Cloud Solutions Architect

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Artificial intelligence (AI) refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think like humans and mimic their actions. In the  month’s talk, catch our experts as they address the challenges holding back the growth of AI and Cloud, how AI systems work, how AI will affect jobs and so much more during our Unitech Talk.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Launching the Intelligent distribution system - an intelligent power distribution network. \n\nThe Huawei #IDS solution builds a "Cloud-Pipe-Edge-Pipe-Device" architecture and applies it for Smart Grid in distribution the space, to reduce the line loss and improve the power supply reliability.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Hannah Han - ED, Energy Industry Sub Saharan Africa gave a brief introduction of what Huawei does in the renewable energy sector in Kenya and across Africa

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Mr. Stephen Nzioka - Director of Renewable Energy Projects, Ministry of Energy  gave his keynote speech during the Huawei Kenya #Energy Summit 2024. \n\nIn his remarks, he underscored the vision 2030 plan for inclusivity, to connect every home with electricity. He went on to add that Kenya needs additional energy capacity through solar, geothermal energy, wind etc. to diversify the energy source and reduce strain on hydro-electric power source

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: Mr. Kebal Wang, Director of energy sector, Huawei Kenya Enterprise, giving his welcome remarks at the Huawei Kenya #Energy Summit 2024\n\nSince 2021, the Huawei Oil&Gas Business Unit and Electric Power Digitalization Business Unit were established to work together with partners to address the needs and pain points of the energy industry, develop solutions, and transition from the traditional sales and service model to the "sales and service + innovation" model.

name: Huawei  Kenya
text: At the Huawei Kenya Energy Summit 2024
